definitions.text: the solid part of the earth's surface
examples: the plane turned away from the sea and moved back over land
the earth shook for several minutes
he dropped the logs on the ground

definitions.text: a rational motive for a belief or action
examples: the reason that war was declared
the grounds for their declaration

definitions.text: the loose soft material that makes up a large part of the land surface
examples: they dug into the earth outside the church

definitions.text: a relation that provides the foundation for something
examples: they were on a friendly footing
he worked on an interim basis

definitions.text: a position to be won or defended in battle (or as if in battle)
examples: they gained ground step by step
they fought to regain the lost ground

definitions.text: the part of a scene (or picture) that lies behind objects in the foreground
examples: he posed her against a background of rolling hills

definitions.text: material in the top layer of the surface of the earth in which plants can grow (especially with reference to its quality or use)
examples: the land had never been plowed
good agricultural soil

definitions.text: a relatively homogeneous percept extending back of the figure on which attention is focused
a connection between an electrical device and a large conducting body, such as the earth (which is taken to be at zero voltage)
(art) the surface (as a wall or canvas) prepared to take the paint for a painting
the first or preliminary coat of paint or size applied to a surface
fix firmly and stably
examples: anchor the lamppost in concrete

definitions.text: confine or restrict to the ground
examples: After the accident, they grounded the plane and the pilot

definitions.text: place or put on the ground
instruct someone in the fundamentals of a subject
bring to the ground
examples: the storm grounded the ship

definitions.text: hit or reach the ground
throw to the ground in order to stop play and avoid being tackled behind the line of scrimmage
hit a groundball
examples: he grounded to the second baseman

definitions.text: hit onto the ground
cover with a primer; apply a primer to
connect to a ground
examples: ground the electrical connections for safety reasons

definitions.text: use as a basis for; found on
examples: base a claim on some observation

definitions.text: press or grind with a crushing noise
make a grating or grinding sound by rubbing together
examples: grate one's teeth in anger

definitions.text: work hard
examples: She was digging away at her math homework
Lexicographers drudge all day long

definitions.text: dance by rotating the pelvis in an erotically suggestive way, often while in contact with one's partner such that the dancers' legs are interlaced
reduce to small pieces or particles by pounding or abrading
examples: grind the spices in a mortar
mash the garlic

definitions.text: created by grinding
examples: grind designs into the glass bowl

definitions.text: shape or form by grinding
examples: grind lenses for glasses and cameras
